com.dougnoel.sentinel.pages

Class PageManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dougnoel.sentinel.pages.PageManager

  • public class PageManager
extends Object
    The Page Manager is a singleton class that manages what page the test is on. Calling setPage with a strong containing the name of the new page calls the Page Factory to create the new page and return it as a Page Object.

    • Method Detail

      • driver

        protected static org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver()

      • setPage

        public static Page setPage(String pageName)
                    throws ConfigurationParseException,
                           ConfigurationMappingException,
                           MissingConfigurationException,
                           IOException,
                           FileNotFoundException,
                           PageNotFoundException,
                           ConfigurationNotFound
        This method sets a Page Object based on the class name passed to it. This allows us to operate on pages without knowing they exist when we write step definitions.

        NOTE: This function is currently only intended for generic step definitions, as it makes the code complex to write otherwise.

        Parameters:
        pageName - String Must be an exact string match (including case) to the Page Object name (e.g. BLAMarketingPortalPage).
        Returns:
        Page Returns a reference to the page in case you want to use it immediately.
        Throws:
        MissingConfigurationException - if the requested configuration property has not been set
        ConfigurationParseException - if error thrown while reading configuration file into sentinel
        ConfigurationMappingException - if error thrown while mapping configuration file to sentinel
        IOException - if other error occurs when mapping yml file into sentinel
        FileNotFoundException - if the sentinel configuration file does not exist
        PageNotFoundException - if page could not be set
        ConfigurationNotFound - if the value is not found in the configuration file

      • getPage

        public static Page getPage()
                    throws PageNotFoundException
        This method returns the current Page Object stored in the Page Manager.
        Returns:
        Page the Page Object
        Throws:
        PageNotFoundException - if the page cannot be found

      • openPage

        public static String openPage(String pageURL)
        Open the URL passed, set the parent window handle and return it.
        Parameters:
        pageURL - String url to open
        Returns:
        String WebDriver handle identifying string - unique for a window and for each tab.

      • open

        protected static void open(String url)
        Opens up the URL passed to it.

        TO DO: Return a page object of the page we are on now.

        Parameters:
        url - String Full URL to navigate to.

      • close

        public static void close()
        Closes the current browser tab or window. Does not quit the driver. If this is the last window open, the next call to the driver will open a new window.

      • quit

        public static void quit()
        Quits the current driver. Subsequent calls to the driver will fail. Should be used at the end of tests only.

      • navigateTo

        public static Page navigateTo(String url)
        Navigates to the given URL.

        TO DO: We should be checking the URL to see if we are going to an existing page, and if so, passing that off as the new page object.

        Parameters:
        url - String the uniform resource locator
        Returns:
        Page the current page object for chaining

      • switchToNewWindow

        public static String switchToNewWindow()
                                throws NoSuchWindowException
        Switches focus of the WebDriver to a new window assuming there was only one before. Finds the handle and passes that to overloaded switchToNewWindow() method

        Preconditions: Expects a new tab or window to have just been opened, and for there to be only two.

        Returns:
        String the window handle we are switching to
        Throws:
        NoSuchWindowException - if only one window is open or if the parent window can not be found
        See Also:
        switchToNewWindow()

      • switchToNewWindow

        public static void switchToNewWindow(String index)
                              throws NoSuchWindowException
        Overloads sentinel.pages.PageManager#switchToNewWindow() to accept a window index. Calls original sentinel.pages.PageManager#switchToNewWindow() and passes the index. This will allow for more fine grained control at a later date.
        Parameters:
        index - String the window to which we want to switch
        Throws:
        NoSuchWindowException - if the expected window is already closed
        See Also:
        switchToNewWindow()

      • closeChildWindow

        public static String closeChildWindow()
        Closes the child window and returns to using the parent window. Used for things like PDFs or links opening in a new tab or window that need to be closed after a test is complete.
        Returns:
        String the handle of the parent window to which we are returning

      • switchToIFrame

        public static void switchToIFrame()
                           throws NoSuchFrameException
        Switches focus of the WebDriver to an iFrame.
        Throws:
        NoSuchFrameException - if no frame is found

      • getCurrentUrl

        public static String getCurrentUrl()
                            throws URLNotFoundException,
                                   org.openqa.selenium.WebDriverException
        Gets the URL of the page we are currently on by calling the Page Object which has access to the driver object..
        Returns:
        String the URL of currently active window
        Throws:
        URLNotFoundException - if URL is not found, or if exception thrown while retrieving the url
        org.openqa.selenium.WebDriverException

      • setDefaultTimeout

        public static org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.Timeouts setDefaultTimeout()
                                                                throws ConfigurationParseException,
                                                                       ConfigurationMappingException,
                                                                       MissingConfigurationException,
                                                                       IOException,
                                                                       FileNotFoundException
        Sets the implicit timeout for the current driver. Calls the Configuration Manager to see if the default timeout or default time unit have been changed through a property. If not, 10 seconds will be set as the default.
        Returns:
        Timeouts returns to allow object chaining for more complex calls
        Throws:
        MissingConfigurationException - if the requested configuration property has not been set
        ConfigurationParseException - if error thrown while reading configuration file into sentinel
        ConfigurationMappingException - if error thrown while mapping configuration file to sentinel
        IOException - if other error occurs when mapping yml file into sentinel
        FileNotFoundException - if the sentinel configuration file does not exist.

      • setTimeout

        public static org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.Timeouts setTimeout(long time)
        Sets the implicit timeout for the current driver in seconds.
        Parameters:
        time - long the number of seconds to wait before reporting a failure to find an element
        Returns:
        Timeouts returns to allow object chaining for more complex calls

      • setTimeout

        public static org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.Timeouts setTimeout(long time,
                                                                TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the implicit timeout for the current driver.
        Parameters:
        time - long the number of seconds to wait before reporting a failure to find an element
        unit - java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit the unit of time to wait (e.g. seconds, milliseconds, etc)
        Returns:
        Timeouts returns to allow object chaining for more complex calls

      • setPageLoadTimeout

        public static org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.Timeouts setPageLoadTimeout(long time,
                                                                        TimeUnit unit)
        Sets page load timeout on web driver instance to the given time in the given unit of time.
        Parameters:
        time - long the number used to set the timeout
        unit - TimeUnit the measurement of time in which the timeout will be set (defaults to seconds)
        Returns:
        Timeouts

      • waitForPageLoad

        public static boolean waitForPageLoad()
                               throws org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException,
                                      InterruptedException,
                                      ConfigurationParseException,
                                      ConfigurationMappingException,
                                      MissingConfigurationException,
                                      IOException,
                                      FileNotFoundException
        Overloads waitForPageLoad method with no parameters, passthrough to waitForPageLoad with default timeout.
        Returns:
        true if page loads, throws exception if an error occurs or page load times out
        Throws:
        MissingConfigurationException - if the requested configuration property has not been set
        ConfigurationParseException - if error thrown while reading configuration file into sentinel
        ConfigurationMappingException - if error thrown while mapping configuration file to sentinel
        IOException - if other error occurs when mapping yml file into sentinel
        org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException - if page load times out.
        InterruptedException - if exception if thrown during Thread.sleep() action
        FileNotFoundException - if the sentinel configuration file does not exist.

      • waitForPageLoad

        public static boolean waitForPageLoad(long seconds)
                               throws org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException,
                                      InterruptedException
        Overloads waitForPageLoad method with one parameters, passthrough to waitForPageLoad with the given timeout and the default TimeUnit of seconds.
        Parameters:
        seconds - long the number of seconds to wait before the page times out
        Returns:
        true if page loads, throws exception if an error occurs or page load times out
        Throws:
        org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException - if page load times out.
        InterruptedException - if exception if thrown during Thread.sleep() action

      • waitForPageLoad

        public static boolean waitForPageLoad(long time,
                                      TimeUnit unit)
                               throws org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException,
                                      InterruptedException
        Sets a pageLoadTimeout and Interfaces with isPageLoaded to continually test if a page is loaded until it returns true or times out
        Parameters:
        time - long the amount of time to wait
        unit - TimeUnit the unit of time to wait for the given time value
        Returns:
        boolean always returns true, will throw exception if page does not load
        Throws:
        org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException - if timeout occurs before the page has loaded (default timeout: 10000 milliseconds)
        InterruptedException - if exception if thrown during Thread.sleep() action
        See Also:
        TODO: It looks like this is not actually using the passed parameters

      • isPageLoaded

        private static boolean isPageLoaded()
                             throws org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException
        Returns true if document.readyState is complete for the current driver, meaning the page has loaded successfully. Uses the driver's pageLoadTimeout setting to throw a TimeoutException if the body element cannot be found on the page.
        Returns:
        boolean true if page has loaded, false if not
        Throws:
        org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException - if timeout occurs before page has finished loading
